meanings.definition: The state of being biased or prejudiced.
meanings.sent1: Her biasnesses towards certain students affected her ability to grade fairly.
meanings.sent2: The biasnesses in the hiring process were evident when only candidates from a certain university were selected.
meanings.sent3: Despite his biasnesses, he tried to make impartial decisions.
meanings.sent4: The biasnesses in her opinions colored her view of the world.
meanings.sent5: The biasnesses in the media can influence public perception.

meanings.definition: The presence of a particular inclination or prejudice.
meanings.sent1: The biasnesses in her taste in music were clear when she only listened to one genre.
meanings.sent2: His biasnesses towards a specific brand made him always choose their products.
meanings.sent3: Even though he claimed to be unbiased, his biasnesses were obvious.
meanings.sent4: The biasnesses in her fashion choices showed her unique style.
meanings.sent5: The biasnesses in his behavior made it hard for others to trust him.
